definition: poles apart (idiom)/as different as can be
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: The job was far from what I had expected.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的工作與我的想象天差地別。

sentences.english: The shape of the two workforces couldn't be more different.
sentences.chinese: 這兩家公司員工隊伍的差異之大簡直天差地別。

sentences.english: Is this ever not how I expected it would be like.
sentences.chinese: 我原來預想的跟這個可是天差地別。

sentences.english: The healing methods that healers use vary greatly from person to person.
sentences.chinese: 對不同的人治療師所用的治療方法天差地別。

sentences.english: God's covenant stands in sharp contrast to worldly culture.
sentences.chinese: 神所立的約與世俗文化天差地別。
